beer.beer_description:
NOTE: This beer is known as 'Somerset Saison' for export markets.

Crisp + Zesty + Spicy 

Epic by name, epic by nature, this Farmhouse Ale is a transcontinental fusion of Belgium’s eclectic beer culture and the feisty hops of North America brought to life with the aid of West Country artisanal brewing wizardry and judicious use of the US-grown Sorachi Ace hop. On the nose, the hops deliver a big splash of tropical fruit, followed by ripples of well-seasoned spiciness spreading outwards. In the mouth a tangy, bittersweet fruitiness holds sway, while tangerine oranges tap dance their way across the tongue in the finish.

NOTE: This beer is known as 'Somerset Saison' for export markets.

user.bio:
Avid real ale & craft beer taster & reviewer.
Grimsby, NE Lincolnshire.  
fozzy21.blogspot.com  The Beermonster's Blog.

user.bio: Recent convert to homebrewing and also like to try lots of different beers but primarily Belgian beers.
Enjoying beer in all forms, craft especially. Also like a drop of whisky.
“Here’s to alcohol: the cause of, and solution to, all of life’s problems.” -- Homer Simpson

items.checkin_comment: Ore take over bottle well past bbe, but still good. Lemony a little grassy. Maybe even vegetably and slightly sour. Overall very enjoyable, pity they don't make the range of different beers they used to. But at least the staples are still going

items.badge_description: You have a keen taste for this Belgian masterpiece. Did you know the Saison style beer was invented by Belgian farms, brewed in the Winter and served the Spring/Summer to all their workers? Well now you do! That’s 35 different Farmhouse Ales! Try 5 more for Level 8.

items.badge_description: While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 5 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.checkin_comment: Aug 2015: passievrucht, brett, groenten. Grassig, citroen.

user.bio:
So be easy and free when you're drinking with me.
    
I'm a man you don't meet every day

items.badge_description: While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 460 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 93!
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 100 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 21!

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 5 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 360 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 73!

You have a keen taste for this Belgian masterpiece. Did you know the Saison style beer was invented by Belgian farms, brewed in the Winter and served the Spring/Summer to all their workers? Well now you do! That’s 40 different Farmhouse Ales! Try 5 more for Level 9.

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 15 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 4!
